The thousand turns say:
After reciting this mantra, evil karma will be eliminated.
Up to seven times, the five heinous crimes will be eradicated.
If ten times are completed, there is no crime that will not be eradicated.
Those who recite it ten thousand times will see AvalokiteÅ›vara with various adornments.
Within seven days, when performing the initial ritual,
One can only eat milk gruel, ghee, curd, white cakes, and cooked rice.
One cannot eat salt, sauces, or vegetables.
On the last day, do not eat.
On the fifteenth day, fast.
In front of the Buddha, recite the mantra continuously without a fixed number.
When the image moves,
it will speak and say Excellent!
It will emit light.
It will place pearls and treasures on top of the mantra master's head.
One will then know that it has been verified.

If a woman is able to recite and uphold it, she will later become a man.

First, set up the altar, make offerings, and prepare everything.
Then begin reciting the mantra. The altar should be sixteen cubits on each side.
Make it in four layers.
The courtyard should be white on the outside and have four colors on the inside.
Each layer is like the shape of a wall.
This makes eight layers.
Combine the colors of the five directions. Open the gates on the four sides.
Correspond with the east, west, south, and north.
The innermost layer in the center does not need to be opened.
Eight large clay pots and four earthenware jars.
Fill them with water and insert cypress and tree branches.
Place the water pots and jars in the center.
Make white cakes, glutinous rice, milk, curd, ghee, honey, fragrant fruits, and other offerings.
Light sixteen lamps.
Outside the four gates, insert sixteen unused arrows.
Hang five-colored threads on the arrows.
Take four branches of khadira wood and purple sandalwood.
Two are five fingers long and two are six fingers long.
Nail the four corners of the altar.
Scatter various seasonal and non-seasonal flowers on the altar.
Also take 1,800 pieces of paugaka wood without knots, each one foot long.
Either a clay bowl or a copper bowl.
Mix ghee and milk to smear these wooden branches.
Recite once for each branch and then throw it into the fire.

One will obtain the wholesome roots accumulated by a thousand Buddhas.
One will turn away from the edge of birth, old age, sickness, and death for a thousand kalpas.
After abandoning this body, one will immediately see a thousand wheel-turning sage kings.
Always uphold the ten wholesome deeds.
If one wishes to be born in the pure lands of the Buddhas,

one will either see a golden Buddha image or a bodhisattva image in a dream. This is a prior sign, and one should know that one will be born in the Pure Land.
